intro: Euphrasia taurica, commonly known as the Taurian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering stems are often branched. Euphrasia taurica is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
